Name: Base of a Ptah-Sokar-Osiris statuette
Description: This base of a Ptah-Sokar-Osiris statuette has a large hollow space at the front. A harrier is perched on the sliding lid. The ornaments on the top corners are missing. A broad band of ankh and was-signs on top of neb-baskets is painted on the sides, bordered on top and bottom by a decorative band. On the top are four columns of text behind the statue, which is now lost, and three in front. The lid is shaped like the roof of a house. The upper surface has a red net with blue dots painted on it. The slender body of the Akhom-falcon is blue and green; the collar is red and black.
